children.title: Community Health Sciences
children.content: About the Department The Department of Community Health Sciences is one of the oldest academic departments within the College of Applied Medical Sciences. Its primary focus lies in preparing qualified national professionals to serve the healthcare sector, contributing to the enhancement of community health, improving the quality of nutritional and therapeutic care provided to patients, promoting health awareness, and empowering individuals to adopt healthy behaviors. Additionally, the department is committed to advancing healthcare services and preserving environmental health. The Department of Community Health Sciences strives to fulfill its educational, research, and community service mission by offering a range of complementary programs aimed at improving community health. These include Clinical Nutrition, Health Education, Health Services Administration, Environmental Health, and Medical Records. The department offers undergraduate programs for both male and female students, as well as postgraduate programs. The undergraduate curriculum begins at the fourth level and includes specialized courses that integrate both theoretical and practical aspects, spread across six semesters. Following this, students are required to complete a mandatory internship year. In its pursuit of keeping pace with advancements in the field of community health sciences, the department has consistently updated its curricula, teaching methods, lecture halls, and facilities, such as the Clinical Nutrition and Health Education laboratories, equipping them with state-of-the-art scientific devices and educational models. Vision To achieve global leadership in community health fields through excellence in academic programs, scientific research, and community service. Mission To prepare specialized professionals with competitive capabilities in the field of community health, produce distinguished scientific research that contributes to building a knowledge-based economy, participate in the health development of the community, and inspire community engagement to positively impact health promotion. Objectives Deliver high-quality educational programs aligned with the latest scientific advancements at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.Prepare competent allied health professionals capable of delivering exceptional healthcare services in specialized fields of community health sciences.Encourage and promote multidisciplinary collaborative research, supporting applied and community-centered studies.Promote health literacy and instill values and attitudes that facilitate the adoption of healthy lifestyles among community members.Provide high-quality healthcare services through skilled graduates and contributions from faculty members.Offer scientific and practical consultancy services and continuous medical education programs for specialists in community health fields.Strengthen partnerships with service sectors and community organizations related to health promotion by fostering collaboration and linking academic processes with societal health needs and labor market demands.

children.content: The College of Nursing at King Saud University is the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia's first nursing college to offer a bachelor's degree in nursing sciences. In 1976, the university established the CON as a college. However, in 1977, the College of Nursing changed its name to the Department of Nursing within the College of Medical Sciences. The Department of Nursing launched the first master's program in nursing in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in 1988, with four major nursing specializations: nursing administration, maternity and pediatric health nursing, medical and surgical nursing, and community health nursing.

children.title: Department of Nursing Administration and Education
children.content: The Department of Nursing Administration and Education was established following the Royal Decree to transform the Nursing Department at the College of Applied Medical Sciences into an independent college, under Royal Decree No. 7/B/1551 dated 8/1/1425 AH. This department was one of the four departments that the college initially included. The department’s goals and philosophy stem from those of the college and the university, and it actively implements them. Along with other departments, the department teaches undergraduate courses in nursing science. It has also been teaching the Nursing Administration and Education specialization at the master’s level in Nursing Science since the time the college was part of the College of Applied Medical Sciences. In addition, the department contributes to teaching courses at the doctoral level in nursing in collaboration with all other departments of the college. The Department of Nursing Administration and Education is staffed with highly qualified nursing professionals, including faculty members with doctoral, master’s, and bachelor’s degrees from leading universities worldwide. 📧 Email: KALDOSRI@KSU.EDU.SA 📞 Phone: 0118063931

children.title: Department of Community and Psychiatric/Mental Health Nursing
children.content: The Department of Community and Psychiatric/Mental Health Nursing is one of the four academic departments within the College of Nursing at King Saud University. It is dedicated to preparing nursing students with the knowledge, skills, and professional competencies required to deliver high-quality, evidence-based care in community and mental health settings. In addition to undergraduate education, the department participates in teaching master’s and PhD courses in community health, primary care, and psychiatric/mental health nursing. Through these programs, it contributes to the development of highly qualified specialists, educators, and researchers who advance nursing practice and scholarship locally and internationally. The goals and philosophy of the department align with the broader mission of the College of Nursing and King Saud University. It emphasizes competencies in both community and mental health nursing and is responsible for teaching these specializations at the master’s and doctoral levels. In addition, the department advances research in community and mental health nursing through its distinguished and experienced faculty members across various nursing specializations. These faculty members enrich the educational process by mentoring students, offering scientific guidance and advice, and actively contributing to research and scholarly studies. Their diverse expertise strengthens the academic experience and enhances the overall quality of education and research in this vital field. 📧 Email: CMH@KSU.EDU.SA 📞 Phone: 0118064139

children.title: Department of Maternal and Child Health Nursing
children.content: The Department of Maternal and Child Health Nursing was established when the Department of Nursing in the College of Applied Medical Sciences was transformed into an independent college, in accordance with Royal Decree No. 7/B/1551 dated 8/1/1425 AH. The department was one of the four departments within the college. The goals and philosophy of the department align with those of the college and the university, and the department works diligently to implement them. It focuses on teaching nursing students the essential skills and knowledge required to care for mothers and children. The department, along with other departments, participates in teaching the undergraduate courses in nursing sciences. It also offers graduate-level courses in Pediatric Nursing, Maternal Nursing, and Midwifery at the master’s level in Nursing Science. Furthermore, the department provides a bachelor’s program in Midwifery, which is considered a distinguished program in this specialization. In addition, the department is committed to advancing research in maternal and child health as well as nursing-related issues in this field through its distinguished faculty members who possess expertise across various nursing disciplines. The faculty contribute to enriching the educational process by mentoring students and providing academic guidance and consultation. They also engage in diverse research and studies, where their wide-ranging research experiences add significant value to the educational process and enhance the quality of education and research in this vital field. 📧 Email: MATERNALCHILD@KSU.EDU.SA 📞 Phone: 63932

The college is considered one of the most distinguished leading colleges in its fields of specialization. It has solidified its pioneering position through implementing several high-quality academic programs and undertaking a comprehensive update of all study plans for the Law and Political Sciences specializations. children.content: The tremendous advances in communication technologies and the increasing interconnection of countries through economic and political relations have made the teaching of foreign languages a vital means of facilitating economic, scientific, and cultural development, as well as enhancing civilizational communication with nations and peoples around the world.

children.title: Department of English
children.content: About the Department: English is the first language in the world in terms of importance, and the second in the number of speakers in several countries such as England, the United States of America, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and other countries. It is also used as a second language in many other regions in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. The importance of the English language stems from its need in many political, economic, commercial, and educational fields. It is essential in diplomatic, commercial, and journalistic representation due to the English publication of some newspapers, magazines, and periodicals in the Kingdom. Also, in petroleum institutions, petrochemical and industrial companies, and other fields. English language has a leading role in disseminating translated Islamic books to introduce Islam, its culture and civilization.
children.contact_info: Contact page not found.

children.title: Department of Linguistics
children.content: About the Department: The Department of Linguistics at King Saud University was established in 1432AH (2011AD) as one of the College of Languages and Translation departments( one of the departments  of College of Languages and Translation) under the Department of Linguistics and Translation Studies. In 1444AH (2022-2023 AD), the department was renamed the "Department of Linguistics" after the restructuring of the college and changing its name to "College of Languages Sciences". In its new identity, the department seeks to provide advanced academic programs in linguistics that contribute to the preparation of specialists with the necessary knowledge and skills to conduct in-depth scientific research with(based on ) data from different languages in various branches of linguistics. Thus, the Department of Linguistics at King Saud University is an essential branch to studying language and related studies such as translation, as it contributes to the development of scientific and research knowledge, and enhances the university's position as a distinguished scientific center in this field. The diversity of their research interests distinguishes faculty members in the department, their scientific contributions represented in the dissemination of scientific research and active participation in conferences and seminars related to linguistics and related sciences. Some faculty members in the department also contributed to transferring knowledge of linguistics to the Arabic language by translating many valuable books in the field.
children.contact_info: Contact page not found.

children.title: Department of French
children.content: About the Department: The French Language Program was established in 1397AH (1977AD) within the Center for European Languages and Translation (Celt) programs. The French language was taught as an optional course for students in all faculties of the university, where the system allows the selection of some courses outside the scope of specialization (ten credit hours). In 1411H (1991), the Bachelor of French Language program was introduced within the programs of the Department of European Languages and Translation, with the establishment of the Institute of Languages and Translation, which in 1415H (1995) turned into the College of Languages and Translation. Then, the program's name was changed to the French Language and Translation Program, which the Department of French Language and Translation provides. After restructuring the college, it was divided into four academic departments in the academic year 1432/1433AH. This program aims to prepare qualified translators in translation to and from French.
children.contact_info: Contact page not found.

children.title: Department of European & Eastern Languages
children.content: About the Department: The Department of European and Eastern Languages is one of the leading departments in the College of Languages Sciences at King Saud University. It is the only department in Saudi Arabia and the Gulf region that grants a bachelor's degree in the following languages: Spanish, German, Japanese, Russian, Hebrew, Persian, and Turkish. The department offers an excellent opportunity to acquire these languages and the ability to understand and communicate with different cultures in an international society that requires multicultural coexistence, opening new horizons for learners of these languages. Students' acquisition of these different languages enhances communication between the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the countries speaking these languages. The department also meets the needs of the labor market by graduating qualified competencies in these languages that can contribute to activating various( to creating) partnerships between the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the countries speaking these languages and building bridges of communication with them in different cultural, economic, and political fields. From this standpoint, the specializations of the department open a promising future for graduates to work in broad and diverse fields in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and abroad due to the urgent need for human cadres who can speak these languages, have a good knowledge of their cultures, and possess the necessary skills to translate to and from these languages. The department provides an excellent opportunity for its graduates to work in many fields and sectors, including foreign companies and others in the private sector, as well as the government and public sector, such as the Ministry of Tourism, the Ministry of Interior, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Investment, the Ministry of Culture, the Ministry of Information, the General Entertainment Authority, the Saudi Tourism Authority, the Royal Commission for the City of Al-Ula, and the Diriyah Gate, in addition to diplomatic and media fields.
children.contact_info: Contact page not found.

children.title: Department of Language Preparation for Non-Arabic Speakers
children.content: About the Department: The Department of Linguistic Preparation for Non-Arabic Speakers offers two programs for teaching Arabic to non-Arabic speakers: 1-The intensive program (Diploma Degree of Proficiency in Arabic Language for Speakers of Other Languages), for international students of both sexes(genders): It consists of four levels, the duration of each level is one semester, in which the student studies twenty (20) hours per week. 2-The non-intensive program: It is intended for non-international students (scholarships) residing in the Kingdom of non-Arabic speaking genders, and includes: Course (Arabic for general purposes) Arabic for general purposes Courses (Arabic for special purposes) Arabic for special purposes Electronic Arabic language education programs for non-native speakers as needed, focusing on distance education. Requirements for admission to a diploma (proficiency in Arabic for non-native speakers): First: The applicant must have a high school diploma or its equivalent. Second: His appreciation should not be less than (very good). Third: He has not previously studied in a similar program in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Fourth: To be free from learning obstacles. Fifth: He shall not be over twenty-five (25) years old. Classification and transition between levels: The student shall be enrolled at the appropriate level, based on his result in the classification test conducted for him after his admission. The student moves from one level to another after obtaining a percentage of (60%) or more of the total grades of the courses of that level.
children.contact_info: Contact page not found.

children.title: Department of Chinese
children.content: About the Department: The Chinese Language Department was established in 1430/1431 AH (2009/2010 AD). Chinese is one of the world's most important languages, ancient and modern, as it carries among its folds and symbols an ancient civilization and culture. Its history extends to thousands of years BC. Its antiquity and richness are matched only by the ancient Arab civilization, which has strong links with China that originated through the land and sea Silk Road and was the trade link between China and the Arab countries, along with the entry of Islam into large parts of China. In modern times, Chinese is one of the five official languages of the United Nations, spoken by nearly a third of the world's population, and its education is widespread in various countries. China is linked to Saudi Arabia and many Arab countries with close economic, trade and political relations, as Saudi investments in China have increased, as well as Chinese investments in the Kingdom, in addition to growing cooperation in several fields, which is witnessing an accelerated development under Vision 2030 and China's "Belt and Road" initiative. Recognizing the importance of languages as a means of communication between people, King Saud University, represented by the College of Language Sciences, established the Department of Chinese Language to keep pace with this rapid development and contribute to the preparation of qualified scientific cadres to meet the needs of the labor market in the Kingdom. The department offers integrated academic programs that include teaching Chinese language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing), in addition to specialized courses in linguistics and translation, which enables students to acquire an in-depth knowledge of the Chinese language and culture, and qualifies them to work in various fields that require mastery of this language.

children.title: Department of Studies of Arabic (L2)
children.content: About the Department: Through its programs, the department aims to qualify and train professional teachers of the Arabic language for non-native speakers, and to develop their theoretical, practical and research experiences.The department focuses on conducting research in the fields of Applied Linguistics , with special attention to methods and methods of teaching Arabic to non-native speakers, preparing its teachers, materials and teaching techniques, in addition to introducing learners to the nature of second language acquisition, the foundations of setting language tests, learning about language learning strategies, and psychological principles related to learning and teaching languages.

title: Regulations and Policies
content:
Anti-Harassment
At King Saud University, we respect each employee and student for who they are and cherish the range of experiences they bring to the university. At the university, we also believe that a constructive and healthy educational environment must be free of any form of harassment, physical or otherwise, that hinders the academic, social, and mental well-being of university affiliates.  As such, King Saud University has adopted a zero-tolerance anti-discrimination and harassment policy. Regardless of color, sex, ethnic or tribal origin, religion, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other trait protected by Saudi law, we firmly believe everyone deserves to be treated with equality, respect, and dignity. Please file a complaint at the following link if you think you or someone you know at the university have been the victim of any form of discrimination or harassment or corruption or human right violation. We take every complaint seriously and with confidentiality. Every complaint will be thoroughly investigated, and action will be swift.In 16-9-1439 H a Royal Decree for anti-harassment in the work place was issued and in 19-9-1444 H, it was amended. It holds all governmental entities the responsibilities to fight every form of harassment including taking advantage of one's position and severely discipline those who engage in such conducts.
For more information:
Anti-Harassment Law
Student
The Student Rights Protection Unit

children.title: Plagiarism
children.content:
Plagiarism
According toplagiarism.org, the concept of plagiarism is misunderstood as a simple act of copying and pasting. It is an “act of fraud” that involves presenting a work under the guise of being the original product of the person who submitted it (plagiarism.org).
Any idea that exists in a published text (whether in a book or online) is considered an intellectual property, which makes attribution a necessity.
Plagiarism will not be tolerated.
Based on Chapter 3; Article 14, the disciplinary regulations are applied on any case that involves cheating (including ghost-writing/plagiarism) in exams, reports, and assignments (9).
Based on Chapter 1; Article 4, no student should use the excuse of not knowing the regulations as a justification for plagiarism in any form. The fact that such notification is being stated in the syllabus makes it legally binding (4).
SUGGESTIONS
If you have any question or any doubt about plagiarism, feel free to contact your instructor. The English Department at King Saud University is equipped with qualified faculty members who can educate you about plagiarism. A simple question would save you from getting a failing grade.
All assignments should follow the MLA8/APA7 format. From the page numbering to the works cited list. Ignorance is not an excuse. Know more about the MLA format from online websites and you should own a copy of the MLA8/APA7 book:
MLA Handbook. 8th ed., Modern Language Association of America, 2016.
Publication Manual of The American Psychological Association.S.L., Amer Psychological Assoc, 2020
If you are a student, please make sure to follow@EngStCouncil1
Review assignments at the Center for Writing in English (CWE) before submission.Appointments can be made by registering and logging into theCWE website.
Appointments can be made by registering and logging into theCWE website.
IMPORTANT LINKS:
Visitplagiarism.org
CheckKSU’s Regulations.
CheckStudent Disciplinary Regulations.

title: Admission Requirements
content: Graduate admission criteria as listed by the Deanship of Graduate Studies.

children.title: Master’s Programs
children.content: A score of at least 70 in the General Aptitude Test, except for students on external scholarships and (executive / medical education) programs.

children.title: PhD Programs
children.content:
A score of at least 45 in the TOEFL-iBT test, 4 in the IELTS Academic test, or 60 in STEP; the concerned department may require a higher score.
A score of at least 70 in the General Aptitude Test, except for students on external scholarships.

children.title: Can I apply for programs offered through the direct admission track for academically distinguished students, as well as programs offered through the general admission track?
children.answer: Yes, you can, within the maximum number of choices available to you. The sorting and selection process will be conducted based on the admission criteria, conditions, and capacity for each program.

children.title: What is the difference between the direct admission track for academically distinguished students in bachelor’s programs and the general admission track for the Common First Year programs and the Sharia program at King Saud University?
children.answer: Admission through the direct admission track for academically distinguished students grants direct entry to specific bachelor’s programs as indicated in the Undergraduate Admissions Guide published on the Deanship of Admission and Registration Affairs’ website. To maintain enrollment through direct admission, the student must achieve a cumulative GPA of no less than 4.50 out of 5 after completing the requirements of the Common First Year, in accordance with the approved study plan. In contrast, admission through the general admission track is for the Common First Year tracks or the bachelor’s program in Sharia. Specialization for those admitted to the Common First Year tracks shall be determined competitively upon the completion of the Common First Year, based on specialization criteria announced at the end of each semester.

children.title: Is priority in admission given to those who received their high school certificate this year?
children.answer: Direct admission to academic programs for academically distinguished students is exclusive to this year’s graduates only. For the general admission track, there is no priority given based on the date of obtaining the high school certificate, provided that the maximum period for the high school certificate date, as mentioned in the general admission conditions, is adhered to.

children.title: Can I apply to King Saud University while I am enrolled in another university or technical college?
children.answer: A student enrolled in another university or college inside or outside the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is not eligible to apply for undergraduate’s admission, in accordance with the approved admission conditions at King Saud University.

children.title: What are the Common First Year tracks and academic programs available for application on the National Unified Admission Portal?
children.answer: You can view the conditions, criteria, admission mechanism, and available academic programs in the Undergraduate Admissions Guide published on the Deanship of Admission and Registration Affairs’ website.

children.title: How can I gain admission into the programs of the College of Engineering or the College of Computer Sciences at the University’s main campus?
children.answer: Direct admission is possible into one of the two colleges’ programs available in the direct admission track for academically distinguished students. For those admitted through the general admission track, admission is competitive through specialization after completing the Common First Year for the scientific colleges track, according to the specialization criteria announced at the end of each semester for those admitted through the general admission track

children.title: Can a student use their results from the General Aptitude and Academic Achievement tests from last year?
children.answer: The highest score obtained by the applicant within the five years prior to the application date is used, according to the validity period of the National Center for Assessment (Qiyas) tests.

children.title: Are students who obtained their high school certificate from within or outside the Kingdom required to take the National Center for Assessment (Qiyas) tests?
children.answer: All Saudi students applying for admission to the University who have a high school certificate in any track (General, Computer Science and Engineering, Health and Life, Business Administration, or Sharia) or its equivalent, whether from within or outside the Kingdom, are required to take both the General Aptitude and the Academic Achievement tests, as they are part of the admission criteria for all Common First Year tracks and bachelor’s degree admission programs at the University.

children.title: How can I obtain my General Aptitude Test score, and which result is used for admission if a student has taken the General Aptitude Test more than once?
children.answer: The score can be obtained from the National Center for Assessment (Qiyas). The highest score obtained on the General Aptitude Test is used

children.title: How are non-Saudi students born to Saudi mothers or mothers of Saudi children admitted?
children.answer: Non-Saudi students whose mothers are Saudi nationals or mothers of Saudi children are treated as Saudis. The student enters their national ID number from their resident identity card (Iqama). If accepted, they must bring the original and copies of their resident identity card, passport, birth certificate, the mother’s national ID card, and the birth certificates of the children for mothers of Saudi children.

children.title: Are there personal interviews for candidates in the health colleges track at King Saud University?
children.answer: There are no personal interviews for the general candidates in the health colleges, nursing, and applied medical sciences tracks. However, some candidates may be summoned for reasons deemed necessary by the specialized committee. If the committee finds a candidate unsuitable for their nominated track, they will be allowed to compete for their subsequent choices at the University and will be admitted based on competitive criteria with other students at the University.

children.title: Why wasn’t I accepted into some specializations even though my high school percentage is high, while someone with a lower percentage was accepted?
children.answer: Admission to King Saud University depends on several criteria with varying weights from one track or academic program (specialization) to another. These criteria and their weights are publicly announced before the admission process begins. Therefore, variations in scores on the General Aptitude and the Academic Achievement tests, in addition to the order of preferences, are important factors in admission.

children.title: When can I get my university ID card?
children.answer: The University ID card is issued during the orientation program organized by the Deanship of the Common First Year for students attending the common first year programs. For students in other programs and degree levels, it can be issued after the start of studies from the Deanship of Admission and Registration Affairs.

children.title: Is it possible to study at the University through distance learning or part-time study options?
children.answer: King Saud University does not offer bachelor’s programs via distance learning or part-time formats. However, the College of Applied Studies offers paid diploma programs through distance learning. For more information, please visit the College’s website at: https://ascs.ksu.edu.sa/en

children.title: Are diploma graduates eligible to pursue their studies for a bachelor’s degree at King Saud University?
children.answer: The University allows a limited number of outstanding diploma holders from King Saud University’s Community College and College of Applied Studies to pursue bachelor’s degrees in select specializations. For more information, please visit https://br.ksu.edu.sa The University also offers a paid completion program for its diploma graduates. For further details, please visit: https://brf.ksu.edu.sa

children.title: Are non-Saudi students eligible for admission?
children.answer: Non-Saudi residents with valid legal residency in the Kingdom may apply to bachelor’s programs for a fee subject to the admission cut-off percentages. For more information, you can visit the Electronic Admissions Portal at: nsadmit.ksu.edu.sa . The University also recruits distinguished non-Saudi students residing in the Kingdom with valid legal residency, as well as international students residing abroad, to study on scholarship in limited seats and in designated programs, in accordance with the applicable regulations in Saudi universities. For more information, please visit: studyinsaudi.moe.gov.sa .

children.title: Can I defer my admission to the next academic year?
children.answer: Admission to bachelor’s or diploma programs may not be deferred. However, applicants may reapply for admission next year.

children.title: If I submit a withdrawal request, when am I eligible to apply again?
children.answer: If the student withdraws during the admission period, he/she shall be considered withdrawn from admission and may apply again during any subsequent admission cycle, as a new applicant, subject to the prevailing admission terms and conditions. If the withdrawal occurs after the commencement of studies, the student is considered withdrawn from the University and may request re-enrollment in the same college under the previous academic status, in accordance with applicable rules and regulations. Should two academic years pass since withdrawal, the student may reapply as a new applicant subject to the relevant policies.

children.title: What are the admission requirements for graduate studies?
children.answer: For inquiries related to graduate programs, please contact the Deanship of Graduate Studies, the competent authority for graduate admissions. The Deanship’s official website may be accessed for further information.

children.title: How is a visiting student admitted to King Saud University?
children.answer: Applications begin before each semester and according to the published schedule. For information on the procedures and conditions for admitting a visiting student, please visit: https://dar.ksu.edu.sa/ar/visitor

children.title: Am I eligible to withdraw more than one course in the same semester?
children.answer: What is the difference between withdrawal from a semester and its postponement, and which one is better?The student is advised to postpone study  in a semester if he knows that he is unable to study that semester. The application is submittedelectronically through the portal before the start of the semester. The period allotted to receiving applications for study postponement expireby the end of the first week of each semester. Postponement  is not be reckoned part the regulated period for completing the study program.As for withdrawal, it is a way to avoid failing all courses in that semester in the event that an urgency stops the student from continuing study.An application for withdrawal  from a semester can be submitted as of the second week  and up to five weeks before final examinations start.It is reckoned part of the regulated period for completing the study program. As a result of withdrawal, the student's monthly stipend issuspended.In both cases, applications are subject to the consideration and approval of the college in which the student study. The student isadvised not to use either unless he/she is entirely unable to attend regularly as this will definitely delay his/her graduation.Is there any particular rule for the student who wants to postpone study due to accompanying her husband?The student trouble committee considers the cases that has changes  of student's social, residential or occupational status.Then recommendations are made to treat each case adequately in the light of the university statutes.Do I have the right to transfer from another university to KSU?Yes, but according to the conditions set by the University Board. In addition, the college to which  you want to transfer should approve it, andsubmission should be in the period assigned to receiving transfer applications.Are all the courses I studied at my university reckoned in case of approving my transfer to King Saud University?The student should submit descriptions of the courses already studied  to the college to which he/she is transferred. The college has the rightto note the courses equivalent to the parallel courses in the study plan provided that the equivalent credit hours do not exceed 40% of the studyplan at King Saud University.Can I get equivalency for courses that I studied as a visiting student at another university without obtaining the approval of King SaudUniversity?No, equivalency is not approved for any course that the student studied at any other university unless the student has first gotten the approvalof King Saud University, which is based on the approval of the college where he/she studies.Is the GPA that I get in the Preparatory Year reckoned in calculating my GPA at the university?Yes, current regulations stipulate that the student's GPA in the preparatory year is reckoned in calculating his/her GPA at the university.Am I eligible to transfer from one track to another in the Preparatory Year?The possibility of Transferring between the tracks of the Preparatory Year is considered by the Vice Rector for Educational and AcademicAffairs. However, it should be noted that it will be incumbent upon the student to study the courses of the track to which he/she wishes totransfer .Thus, the completion of the preparatory yearwill be delayed.

children.answer: - The student applies to the Department of the Preparatory Year Affairs in the Deanship of Admissions and Registration, after filling out

children.title: Number of credit hours allowed to enroll in
children.answer: What is the maximum of the credit hours that I can register in one semester when I am graduating?The regulations stipulate that the Rector - or his proxy – may approve increasing the schedule load of student  expected to be graduated upto (24) credit hours. The Deanship Admissions and Registration considers those applications provided that the student obtains  the approvalof the college where he/she studies.

children.title: What is the maximum of the credit hours that I can register in one semester when I am graduating?
children.answer: What is the maximum of the credit hours that I can register in the summer session?The maximum number of credit hours for any summer session is (9). However, it is allowed for the graduated student to increase providedthat the Deanship approves it.Can I know if I will get a warning next semester?The student gets a warning due to the decrease of the GPA below the minimum. He/she can calculate the GPA on the assumption that he/shegets certain grades in the courses that are being studied now. The following is an example:An example for calculating the semester and cumulative averages:The First Semester

children.answer: The average of the first semester=total of points(48.25) /total of units(12) = 4.02The Second Semester

children.title: Do I have the right to transfer from one college to another and what are the conditions?
children.answer: Does the student have the right to request checking grade he obtained in a certain course if he/she thinks it is different from whathe/she deserves?Yes, the student has the right to object to both of his semester work and final test grades according to the mechanism stated in the executiverule of the study and exam statutes for the collegiate stage in its articles no. (23) and (39).I would like to apply for giving me the opportunity to complete my studies, what is the quarter that I may apply to it for that?The college to which the student belongs.

children.title: I would like to apply for giving me the opportunity to complete my studies, what is the quarter that I may apply to it for that?
children.answer: If I withdraw my file from the university, when may I have the right to submit again?If I you apply to draw the file during the admission period in the first month, you will be considered  a non-matriculated student withdrawingfrom admission. As a result, you will have the right to submit  to the University, when it is announced that admission is open, as a new studentaccording to the admission requirements stated at the time.If one month passes after being awarded admission , you will be considered a matriculated student withdrawing from the university.Thus,  you are entitled to apply to the college to which you were admitted for reinstatement on the basis of  your previous status beforewithdrawal according to the rules and regulations, namely Article 17, paragraph ( a) and ( b) .If four semesters pass after terminating  your university enrollment, you are eligible to submit as a new student  according to the rules andregulations, namely Article 17, paragraph (c).

children.title: If I withdraw my file from the university, when may I have the right to submit again?
children.answer: What is the mechanism of allocation of non-Saudi students?Allocation of non-Saudi students depends on three factors:• Type of scholarship on which the student has been admitted.• The number of seats available for non-Saudis as directed by the Ministry of Higher Education.• GPA of the student after completing the Preparatory Year.

Information
children.content:
ABOUT LIBRARY

The library was established on 1389H.  It is located inside the building of the college of medicine at the University Medical City at Direia (الدرعية), and it is a specialized library in the field of medicine and medical sciences.  The library provides it services to the students of medical and sciences colleges in the university and the employees of the hospital.





Library Map

Ground Floor:  located the division of journals

First floor:  located the general book's room, the references, lending and directional services, the intelligent room and the terminals, reading room for women, and copy machines.  The total area of the library is approximately 1584 m2.



Library Services

There are around 80 computers designated for the searching on the internet and searching on the (unicorn system) which is specialized in searching books, and databases provided by the university, in addition to the digital library.  Also the users can use wireless communication to the computer from their personal computers.



Rooms

Reading Room:  This room is furnished with tables and chairs, and the university provide a number of daily newspapers for the users.



Intelligent Room

This room is designed to provide the service of introducing the library and making short courses for the users in the use of different types of information vessels at the library.



Room for Women:  This room is designated for females, and furnished with all necessities, such as tables, chairs and computers.



Working Hours of the Library:

The library is open from Sunday to Thursday 8:00 A.M to 4.30 P.M.



Contact info

About library

The library was established on 1400, and located in the first building of King Abdul-Aziz University Hospital, in the fourth floor, with a total area of 265m2, with the capacity of 36 seats, and considered as specialized medical library in the field of ENT, and optics medicine.  The library provides its services to the hospital physicians and workers.



INFORMATION ABOUT LIBRARY

The library was established on 1400, and located in the first building of King Abdul-Aziz University Hospital, in the fourth floor, with a total area of 265m2, with the capacity of 36 seats, and considered as specialized medical library in the field of ENT, and optics medicine.  The library provides its services to the hospital physicians and workers.



The library consists of the following:

Unit One:  Men Division (contain Arabic and foreign medical books and references, and also a reading hall for newspapers, and a hall for the search over the internet.



Unit Two:  Women Division (contain general and specialized medical journals) it has a reading hall, between these two units there is a reception counter (lending and direction service), a computer devices designated for searching and internet and Unicorn System.



Services provided for users:

The library is providing a number  8 computer enable the researcher through its system to browse all types of information vessels available in the university's libraries in different fields of knowledge and specialties, and make the internet and medical and others databases available for users which the university contribute membership annually.  Also so the copying for any articles, research, or subject included in the medical library contents, and the library is receiving a number of requests and inquiries from the other medical libraries either from inside the Kingdom hospitals or from the Gulf States according to the availability of the information in the library.

Paper continuous membership for more than (12) journals of ENT, and around (9) annual journals in optical sciences.  (17) General journal.  The rest of journals received either through gifting from different entities, or through membership of Faculty Members and consultants in the hospitals.



Working Hours of the Library:

The library is open from Sunday to Thursday 8:00 A.M to 3:30 P.M.

Procedural Guide for Registration in Student Housing
children.content:
Procedural Guide for Registration in Student Housing
Procedural Guide for Registration in Student Housing
Conditions of residence in the university housing
1. The student must be a regular student at the university and registered for the semester in which he wishes to reside in housing.
2. He must not have been previously dismissed from the residence as a result of violating the rules or regulations in force within the housing.
3. The student shall adhere to university housing regulations and rules and shall not violate them.
How to apply for housing :
Access the Academic System Portal and follow these steps :
Step 1/  Login to the Academic Student Portal and select from the  side menu Electronic Applications University Student Housing
Step 2/ Read the terms of the housing contract and press OK
Step 3 / Choose Reservation for Accommodation and Parking
Step 4/  Choose the category, then choose the building, then choose the room, then tap Book.
Step 5 / The system will issue an invoice (Sadad) with your university number. The invoice must be paid within 24 hours through banks. You can then go to the Student Housing Department to receive your room
